 135:         """

 140: 
 141:         # frequency of the triangle wave is given by timer as follows [4]:
+142:         freq_hz = CPU_FREQ_HZ * 1. / (32. * (self.period + 1))

 143: 
 144:         # how much phase we step with each cycle is given by
 145:         #   phase_per_samp = cycles per sample = (freq_hz / samples per second)
 146:         # unit of phase here is CYCLES not radians (i.e. 1 cycle = 2pi radians)
+147:         phase_per_samp = freq_hz / SAMPLE_RATE
  __pyx_v_phase_per_samp = (__pyx_v_freq_hz / ((double)__pyx_e_3nes_6cycore_3apu_SAMPLE_RATE));

 148:

 239:         """
 240:         Adjust the period based on the sweep unit.  Part of the functionality here is based on the following paragraph
 241:         from [12]:
 242:             "When the channel's period is less than 8 or the result of the shifter is
 243:              greater than $7FF, the channel's DAC receives 0 and the sweep unit doesn't
 244:              change the channel's period. Otherwise, if the sweep unit is enabled and the
 245:              shift count is greater than 0, when the divider outputs a clock, the channel's
 246:              period in the third and fourth registers are updated with the result of the
 247:              shifter."
 248:         This seems to disagree a little with [13] in that the description in [13] permits zero as a shift
 249:         value (and even uses it as an example), whereas the above text excludes it.  This makes a difference in the
 250:         game Ghengis Khan, which if 0 is permitted as a shift has background music which sounds wrong (and differs from
 251:         FCEUX) in the main game screens.
 252: 
 253:         In the system here, adjusted_period is used to determine whether or not the period has been changed outside of
 254:         the permitted range, silencing the channel (without adjusting period outside that range).  Don't know if this is
 255:         correct, but it seems to be what is implied in [12].
 256: 
 257:         Finally, should the change amount be based on the non-adjusted period or the adjusted period?  I.e. should the
 258:         period be irrevocably altered by the sweep unit, or is the original period retained somewhere and used to
 259:         calculate the shift each time?  In a recurring multiple shift, this changes the frequency change rate from
 260:         exponential to linear.  No clear idea of what is correct.
 261:         """
 262:         cdef int change_amount
+263:         if self.sweep_reload:
  if (__pyx_v_self->sweep_reload) {
/* … */
  }

 265:             # is cleared. [7]
+266:             self.sweep_divider = self.sweep_period
    __pyx_t_1 = __pyx_v_self->sweep_period;
    __pyx_v_self->sweep_divider = __pyx_t_1;

+267:             self.sweep_reload = False
    __pyx_v_self->sweep_reload = 0;

+268:             return
    goto __pyx_L0;

 269: 
+270:         if self.sweep_divider > 0:

 271:             # Otherwise, the counter is decremented. [7]
+272:             self.sweep_divider -= 1

 273:         else: # self.sweep_divider == 0:
 274:             # If the divider's counter is zero [...], the counter is set to P and the reload flag is cleared. [7]
+275:             self.sweep_divider = self.sweep_period
